channel.title: Computer Vision on Shengting Cao's Note Book
channel.description: Recent content in Computer Vision on Shengting Cao's Note Book

item.title: Computer vision problem and step by step
item.description: This post is review some cases in computer vision problem. How all the method constructed. LeNet-5 This network use 60k parameters, relative small network. Network get deeper hight, width get smaller, channels larger. Note: sigmoid/tanh , non-linear in avg pool, II and III of the paper. AlexNet using Relu Multiple GPUs local response normalization (doesn't help much) VGG -16 Uniform large network VGG-19 is a bigger version of network

item.title: Computer vision problem and step by step
item.description: Max Pooling Hyper-parameters: f = 2 , s = 2 no parameters to learn $$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 3 & 2 & 1 \\ 2 & 9 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 3 & 2 & 3 \\ 5 & 6 & 1 & 2 \end{bmatrix} => \begin{bmatrix} 9&2\\ 6&3 \end{bmatrix} $$ Divide the 4*4 to 4 area and pick the largest number to get a 2 * 2 data.

item.title: Computer Vision problem step by step
item.description: Vertical edge detection Before know how to do the vertical edge detection, we could first know how the convolution operation works in image processing. we can have a convolution operation like this * means convolution: $$\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 0 & 1 & 2 & 7 & 4 \\ 1 & 5 & 8 & 9 & 3 & 1 \\ 2 & 7 & 2 & 5 & 1 &3 \\ 0 & 1 & 3 & 1 & 7 & 8 \\ 4 &2&1&6&2&8 \\ 4& 2& 1& 6& 2& 8\\2& 4& 5& 2& 3& 9 \end{bmatrix} * \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 &-1 \\ 1 & 0 & -1 \\ 1 & 0 & -1 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} -5 & -4 & 0 & 8 \\ -10 & -2 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & -2 & -4 & -7 \\ -3 & -2 & -3 & -16 \end{bmatrix} $$
